p.seg: What the Annals sorts out properly
concerns others and oneself.
That by means of which it sorts out properly what concerns others and oneself
are kind-heartedness and righteousness.
By means of kind-heartedness one brings comfort to others,
by means of righteousness one straightens out oneself.
So the essential meaning of kind-heartedness is concerned with others
whereas the essential meaning of righteousness is concerned with oneself.
Speech names these in order to distinguish between them.
The relation between 'kind-heartedness' and 'others'
and the relation between 'rigteousness' and 'oneself'
must definitely be properly understood.
The hoi polloi do not understand these relations:
and then by means of kind-heartedness they try to enrich themselves,
The hoi polloi do not understand these relations:
and then by means of kind-heartedness they try to enrich themselves,
and by means of righteousness they try to provide for others.
Since they get the place%3Eobject of their actions wrong, and they go against the underlying principles
and few of them end with anything other than misrule.
Therefore no one aims for misrule
but by and large they constantly practise misrule.
As a matter of principle, in this way they are in the dark on the distinction between 'others' and 'oneself'
and they fail to reflect on wherin kind-heartedness and righteousness consist.
So then, the Annals practise the method of kind-heartedness and righteousness.
The method of kind-heartedness consists in taking good care of others,
and it does not consist in taking good care of oneself.
The method of righteousness consists in controlling oneself properly,
it does not consist in controlling others properly.
If one does not control oneself properly
then even if one were to control others properly
we cannot concede that one counts as righteous.
If others are not exposed to his good care,
then even if he takes abundant care of himself
we do not concede that the person counts as kind-hearted.
